Fun with linear types and quantum computing in Haskell

Posted on May 5, 2021 by Noon van der Silk

When the linear Haskell extension was announced, I got excited and started playing around with linear-base.

While the linear haskell paper suggests a few ways to use linear types, one of the must fun ideas to me is to use it for expressing quantum algorithms.

The background is that a theorem, the No-Cloning Theorem, constrains how variables in quantum algorithms can be used.

The game, then, is can linear types in Haskell help enforce this rule? Turns out, yes! Let’s have a look:
